battleships package¶

battleships.components module¶

Contains functions for core game functionality

components.create_battleships(filename: str = 'battleships.txt') → dict¶

Reads in the battle ships from the filename passed

components.initialise_board(size: int = 10) → list[list]¶

Returns an empty grid of dimensions size

components.place_battleships(board: list[list], ships: dict, algorithm: str = 'simple') → list[list]¶

Places the battle ships onto the board and returns the outcome

algorithms include “simple”, “random”, “custom” and “optimal”

—Parameters— board: List[List] ships: dictionary algorithm: string —Return— List[list]

battleships.enhanced_ai module¶

Enhanced AI for playing against the player. Warning much harder to beat!

enhanced_ai.check_attack(coordinates: tuple, board: list[list]) → bool¶

Checks if battle ship at coordinate provided

enhanced_ai.generate_attack_improved(board: list[list], attack_stack: list[tuple]) → tuple[tuple, list[tuple]]¶

Generates an attack. If the previous attack has hit a ship, it will continue to hit this ship until it has sunk

battleships.game_engine module¶

Run this file when playing the simple battleships in CLI

game_engine.attack(coordinates: tuple, board: list[list], battleships: dict) → bool¶

Checks if battle ship at coordinate provided If there is:

Decrements the battleship Changes board at coordinates to none Checks if sunk Returns true

if not:

Returns false

game_engine.cli_coordinates_input() → tuple[int, int]¶

Prompts user to input x and y coordinates to attack with via CLI

game_engine.simple_game_loop() → None¶

Starts the game via the CLI with simple placement of ships

battleships.main module¶

battleships.mp_game_engine module¶

Run this file when playing against the AI in the CLI

mp_game_engine.ai_opponent_game_loop() → None¶

Starts the game via the CLI against AI

mp_game_engine.generate_attack(board_size: int = 10) → tuple¶

Generates a tuple with coordinates within the board

mp_game_engine.pretty_print_board(board: list[list]) → None¶

Prints 2D array (board) like a table into terminal For pretty output ensure terminal window is large
